title: Riot plans to support melee champions, let's give them some ideas
body:
So Asyrite said that riot understands how ranged champions (aka marksmen) are always first compared to melees and they plan to support melees instead of skewering them into splitpushing styles (aka tryndamere)

i expect changes to be done in either season 9 or late season 8, rune reforged will take pre season 8 focus, then during season 8 they will start to work on this problem.

idea 1: give more melee/ranged penality on items
Looking at {{item:3153}}  this item was fine on melees but gave early powerspike to ranged champions which is why they increased the cost by 200 and reduced lifesteal. one of the possible change was making it 4% damage on ranged champions and 8% on melee champions
other candidates: {{item:3124}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3071}}  {{item:3087}} 

idea 2: stronger base stats for melees
i know it's already the case but i feel like it's a joke
Yi for instance compared to kalista gets +30 base ms+200 hp at lvl 18+5 bonus base ad +10 mr at lvl 18 and -5 armor at lvl 18, is this enough to balance a -500 range in a game without turn rate? i don't think so
i feel like except extreme exceptions melees do not have enough bonus stats to compet with ranged champions.

idea 3: make ranged champions unable to move until they finish their basic attack, no more auto-attack cancel in mid animation. similar to kalista passive. Make them miss the attack if they lose vision.

idea 4: for god sake please fixe the fact that minions are more friendly to ranged champions in this game.
the aggro radius of minions is just too small, ranged champions can ignore it while melee champions are punished if they try to all-in a ranged champions, it's literally unfair.

idea 5: you need something to balance CC, this game needs a massive CC revamp because the way designers made champions in the last 3 years was a total "we don't care about melees". 90% of league's cc are skillshots with a travel time, this is not good because melees are more punished more than ranged champions just by existing, they can't dodge skillshots in melee range while ranged champions can dodge them by staying away.
let's take dota2 as an example. 
In this game most cc are point and click making it fair for everyone (melee or ranged) you can only outplay them by blinking(called disjoinct) or buying cc immunity and using the item in time (reactive mechanic) linken sphere also allows you to block one point and click spell each 13 seconds (banshee but for point and click spells)

i think league needs to give a cc immunity item for melees just like BKB in dota. "but then yi is op tryndamere is op" **this is a pre-season lvl of work** of course things will be op but then riot has to rebalance all the band-aids they gave to melees like {{item:3044}}  that just do not work.
an other idea is to have skillshot ccs stunning/slowing for a shorter duration in melee range like {{champion:103}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:113}} 

fun fact: tanks that do not bring balance problems right now are {{champion:14}} {{champion:516}}  and that because their cc can be dodged by melee champions
Sion ult cannot be dodged in melee range, **and THIS IS WHY it stuns for a short time  in melee range**

feel free to post your ideas/comment on the discussion

Melee champions should have no bonus magic resist or health or other stats that push them above the basic stats of ranged champions, but should take X% reduced damage and have Y% tenacity versus any crowd control or damage they receive from the front, that way they can approach a team fight from the outside and begin contributing without being blown up or locked down-- but without enabling them to simply dive into the middle of 5 people and roflstomp everything.

I realize this sounds stat checky, but it really isn't because it offers nothing to the melee champion if he is flanked, because his back side is still unprotected. Versus slower travel time or more telegraphed effects, he may be able to micro his facing to diminish as much damage and cc as possible, but I regard that the same way I regard stutter stepping by ranged champions-- its just an expression of skill and is a completely fair way to raise the skillcap on melee champions.

It also offers a form of counterplay versus melee champions that is on the same level in terms of depth and expression as the prevalent counterplay versus ranged champions. With a ranged champion the counterplay is to close the distance or work with your allies to coax the enemy ranged champion into a vulnerable position. With melee champions the counterplay would be to flank or to work with your allies to coax the melee champion into a vulnerable position.

Because this sort of change offers both depth and fairness, I think it is strictly better for the game than a change that only offers fairness but reduces depth. For instance, I don't think giving all melee champions a straight stat boost would be appropriate (and the stat boost they currently receive probably isn't appropriate) because it reduces the game to a single checkbox-- "can the melee champion close the distance and kill the ranged champion before dying?". The change I suggest is better because it offers ways for the melee champion to have an influence without being propped up by stats or reducing the game to a single checkbox-- positioning is more nuanced than "did i have enough stats?".

Not only does it make balancing easier, it makes it so the balanced state doesn't have to be broken. Strengths and weaknesses are a good thing but there are limits.

The raise in the amount of crit chance did the same thing where adcs can crit you 4 times before you reach near them you cant afford to be building crit yourself when you die before you get to do any damage.

Part of the reason it's so difficult for melee champions is because a lot of ranged champions have just so much disengage that it becomes impossibly annoying to stick to them.

Trying to go in on {{champion:150}} ? Mini form he hops away, and as soon as his W's passive procs you really can't do much.

What about {{champion:133}} ? Her E makes it quite annoying to get on her without a second gapcloser.

{{champion:126}} (though he's technically also melee)? In melee form he knocks you away, then swaps to ranged form and kites.

And that's only three top laners. Marksmen often have similar if not more tools to disengage (exceptions include kog'maw and twitch). Mages also have tools to disengage, although not nearly as powerful as the marksmen class.

I think the easiest first step would be to lock them in place until they fire the auto attack. Cancelling an auto essentially means you cannot chase them unless they stand there and auto attack. In other words, you can't just right click an enemy then immediately move 1/5 of a second later. You have to wait until your next auto is ready. That might be a little harsh, but items won't really solve the problem alone, unless those items are hilariously broken and if they are, they become mandatory.

Certainly agree on 1, 2 and 4.
3 would help balanceing, but at the cost of makeing ranged champs feeling horribly clunkly with a bad game-flow. I'd rather see bigger base ms differences instead.

5 I agree that CC is an issue, but i don't think the dota way is appropiate for League. What imo needs to be done:

 - changeing slows to flat values with some exeptions like nunu E or nasus W so they no longer hit high ms champs harder than low ms champs.
 - Let tenacitiy affect knowckups and displace, give a short stacking up tenactiy buff whenever you get hard-cced to counter cc-chaining(maybe melee only or higher values for melees)
 -  more tenacity/slowresist options in items or intergrate more of that and/or other anti CC mechanics in the kit of champs that really need it(mostly immobile fighters) 
 - More CC that gets the duration increased with traveldistance
 - less uptime on slows in general

Aditionally, i think supports and support itemisation need to be looked at aswell. As it is, we have few supports that really can support melee's properly, espcially the deep-diveing ones as the simply can't follow them into the fight and stay in range.
As example: a Yi with morgana's black-shield sounds powerfull, but if you try to execute it, you soon notice that her lack of mobillity and the low range on black shield make it really hard to use it effectively on YI in teamfights.

If you want to fix bruisers, you need to first nerf everything putting it down. ADC damage needs to drop (this also makes their lifestealing drop), supports need a huge fucking nerf and Riot should publicly apologize for sucking the class off too long, tanks should get longer cooldowns (and some items lose CDR). This solves being perma CCed and insta-DPSed down.

Simple changelist coming at you:

Marksmen - I like Cleaver on ADCs. I think diversity is cool, but, if you build Cleaver, your late game should be weaker for having less Crit chance.
Critically Reworked: Critical Chance renamed to Critical Strength. Critical Strength increases your damage dealt by basic attacks (except onhit effects) by X percent. X is your critical strength. Not only does this give reliably to Gangplank, it also makes Tryndamere more consistent and not luck based.
Critically Addressed Interactions: The bonus damage applied by Critical Strength is what is counted as your Critical Damage. Omen and IE decrease/increase only this damage multiplictively, rather than the whole attack. (This might be a nerf to Omen or something (Just realized while typing RFC/Shiv that this technically buffs Yasuo, sorry. Just increase his self Crit reduction.), but future adjustments can be made. _It's the idea that matters, not the numbers._)
Omen: Reduces only Critical Damage, instead of the whole attack. (May need changing.)
Infinity Edge: Increases only Critical damage, instead of the whole attack. Eg: Someone with IE + Zeal (40% Critical Strength) will actually deal damage as if they had 60% Critical Strength.
Rapid Firecannon: Passive now disables the passive of Stattik Shiv. (Whoever is in the highest item slot takes priority.)
Stattik Shiv: Passive now disables the passive of Rapid Firecannon. (Whoever is in the highest item slot takes priority.)
Death's Dance: Damage converted into a DoT reduced to 20%. -5 AD.
The Bloodthirster: -5 AD.
Essence Reaver: Mixed identity calls for a rework. Now costs 3000 gold, builds from Pickaxe + Caulfield's + Cloak of Agility, and gives 60 AD, 20% Critical Strength, and 20% CDR. Now it's an early game item that scales slightly, instead of broken on ADCs once they hit a two item spike if they have strong/broken abilities (Xayah is our huge offender).
B. F. Sword: Since ER was changed, BF is changed to replace powerspikes botlane (making it more forgiving) to near equalize with Pickaxe + Longsword. Cost reduced to 1150 and loses 5 AD.
Berserker Grieves: Look, as a Kayle main (Kayle rushes these boots often), I hate to do this, but -5% attack speed.
Lord Dominik's Regards: The damage boost is super broken. Damage increase lowered to 15%, health difference required for full boost increased by 1.5x (This is just so late game Cho'Gath and uber-tanks take damage without doing absurd damage to bruisers).
Phantom Dancer: Just because you've been broken for 2 years doesn't mean you get off the hook. Damage reduction lowered to 8%, Attack speed lowered by 5%.

Tanks - Fuck off. Least skill class that Riot consistently pushes for no fucking reason; hypocrisy I say! Anyways, tanks being broken require ADCs to be broken and vice versa. Both need to be cut down so bruisers can exist. _At first you needed a mage, marksmen, and a bruiser to have enough damage, now all you need is a mage and marksmen and tanks have gotten tankier._
Maokai: Q down 10/15/20/25/30 base damage. Q and W cooldown's up; R snare reduced.
Sejuanni: I don't know, just nerf the CC and cooldowns.
Zac: Revert to preupdate. Fucking cancer CC, but surely reducing his damage solves that issue (Kappa).
Stoneplate: Fuck this item. Anyone who's played since season 4 minimum can look at this and say "Wow, those stats look really broken." Active (Greater) HP boost reduced to 80% from 100%; Bonus Armor/MR gained while 3 enemies are near reduced by 10; Cost increased by 150.
Cinderhulk: Revert every change made that made into "viable", then reduce cost by 75 gold. Build path changes based on next change.
Sunfire Cape: DoT damage increased vs champions (but same for Waveclear). Build path changes based on next change.
Bami's Cinder: Builds from 2 Ruby Crystal, new cost of 1100 gold, and gives 350 HP now.
Sunfire, Omen, and Deadmans: Considering ADCs are losing more than substantial amounts damage, -3 armor for each of these (Deadmans will get buffs later).
Adaptive Helm: Here is my idea. Damage reduction vs repeated spells reduced to 12%, HP increased by 50. Loses 10% CDR. What about Cassiopeia? Nerfed. No need to have every DPS mage broken to be viable because Adaptive Helm is broken.

Supports - Stop calling this class weak. Support is probably more important than mid lane right now. Shield stacking wasn't such a huge issue until they gave free +% Heal/Shield Power.
Ancient Coin: Gold generate reduced. (Increasing every support item up to it just powercreeps the support role making them more broken).
Ardent Censer: Attack speed bonus reduced 15%. Heal/Shield Power reduced to 8%.
Redemption: Heal/Shield Power reduced to 8%.
Mikeal's Crucible: Heal/Shield Power reduced to 16%.
Forbidden Idol: Heal/Shield Power reduced to 6%.
Locket: Health ratio reduced to 15% bonus HP from 2%-bullshit%. Secondary Locket Shields reduced from 50% power to 25%.
Knight's Vow: Damage reduction and heal based on ally damage reduced to 8%.
Braum: Passive increased to 5 stacks to stun, or nerf the time it stuns if they REALLY want to keep the icon for it.
Rakan: Ok, fuck you for being super broken right now. W knockup reduced to 0.75 seconds (from 1 second). R charm duration reduced to 1 second (from 1/1.25/1.5). If he's weak, give his W +10 damage and maybe his Q +5 heal or damage. (Nerfed because tenacity doesn't affect his CC)
Lulu: Shield increased by 10/15/20/25/30. Polymorph reduced from bullshit-bullshit to 1.1/1.2/1.3/1.4/1.5.
Janna: Not sure, just nerfed slightly (since Coin, Ardent, and ADC nerfs already hurt her, she doesn't need it as hard HOPEFULLY).

Bruisers - The class shit on for so many years, it makes me sick. Items always stolen, Class update slot stolen, class update 2012, 2013, 2014, 2017 all canceled. This time, we make them viable.
Jaurim's Fist: No longer stacks, now gives all it's stats on buy.
Frozen Mallet: Melee only. (Fuck you Kog'Maw) Maybe other changes but I lack ideas.
Sterak's Gage: Buildpath changed to Jaurim's Fist + Ruby Crystal, HP increased by 100, shield threshold lowered significantly on later ranks.
Maw of Malmortius: This was stolen by assassins a bit and is a common buy on ADCs who go mid. Doubled shield for melee would break the item on assassins, so a different change is required. It doesn't stack with Sterak's Gage, so it will need it's own niche too. Shield now scales with 15% bonus health.
Guinsoo's Rageblade: "Why can't Rageblade be buffed for melee champions?" a certain Jax main asked. The Rioter supposedly responded, "Because Kog'Maw still uses it." Attack speed per stack reduced from 8% to 5%, total stacks increased to 8, melee champions gain 2 stacks per attack, +5% attack speed to basic stats, cost reduced by 200, and Guinsoo's Rage reworked. _Guinsoo's Rage - At max stacks, grants ~~Phantom Hit~~ +5 (+15% bonus AD)(+7.5% bonus AP) onhit magic damage to your target and nearby enemy units._ This should sound familial, but Phantom hit is near unbalancable due to certain interactions in some kits being too unhealthy. (Btw, this old passive means it works with Gunblade again.)
BoRK: Should technically be under Marksmen, but let's just fix this. +3% lifesteal, onhit damage reduced to 6.5% for ranged champions (Fuck you Kog'Maw), cost reduced by 100.
Ninja Tabi: Technically should be under Tank changes. Since marksmen are losing so much damage, this item, which is powerful, it getting a bit of change. Basic attack damage reduction reduced to 8% (Critical damage isn't affected by this damage reduction btw), but now gains 5% Critical Damage Reduction. (This is a wild change. It could be completely overestimating how much the change to marksmen will be.)
Merc Treds: Tenacity increased to 35%. If CC locking is still kinda an issue, then make Tenacity affect knockups/knockbacks.
Trinity Force: This item costs so fucking much I think it's absurd. -200 Cost.

New Items: I'll just copy what I had in another comment.

300 Health, 30 Attack Damage, 40% Attack Speed

One huge problem for top laners is the fact that abilities do not draw minion aggro, only auto attacks. Champions like Gnar, Kennen, Teemo, Ryze and Quinn can harass safely from a distance with their Qs while standing in a crowd of minions so the melee aggressor can't fight back. There's simply no reason for this. If minions are supposed to be part of the trading process and positioning, an ally taking damage from an enemy champion for any reason should be enough to get them in the fight. 

An easy suggestion, and one that has been made before, is to make AD, Armor, and Health items give % of a champion's base, rather than simply giving a flat amount. This will make the items as a whole weaker when you first buy them, but will definitely make them a lot easier to balance on a melee/ranged basis. The headache is when champions like Jayce buy health items, then they switch forms. But that's Riot's fault for making form changing champions in the first place, so it's up to them to figure out a fair way of making it work. 

AP obviously can't scale because you don't have any, and I think AP itemization is perfectly fine the way it is so leave it be. MR doesn't really work either since every champion has the same MR based on melee or ranged, so just leave MR itemization the way it is along with AP and things will be fine.

We also need a strictly anti-kiting item. I think they should bring back the old version of Cold Steel that lowered a target's movement speed whenever they attacked the target. Honestly, marksmen have been given so much mobility and sustain to deal with assassins that being able to kite divers successfully is a big problem.

One issue to look at would be Turret Advantage. Ranged have better harass and defense at towers. The distance melees have to run to safety is longer, which is why mid lane is more dominated by the ranged. Also ranged only has to be around the edge of allied turret range to be safe whereas melee needs to be on the other side of their turret. Minions don't go past the turrets meaning that melees are more easily harassed when last hitting, whereas ranged can last hit from the other side of their turret.

I would suggest to buff the mastery "Siege-master". Currently it only gives flat 8 armor and magic resist at an allied tower. For melees only the armor and magic resist should scale and work at any tower.

Because of Runes Reforged this suggestion probably doesn't matter but if the mastery gets carried over into the new system that's  what I would suggest.
